title: 112_s3214
content: The "Today's Entrepreneurs are America's Mentors Act" or the "TEAM Act" defines terms like "Administration" and "small business concern" under the Small Business Act. It also establishes an Office of Entrepreneurial Education within the Small Business Administration. The "TEAM Act" establishes the Office of Entrepreneurial Education within the Administration to provide innovative entrepreneurial information and resources for prospective entrepreneurs and small business concerns. The Director of the Office manages online courses and publications for entrepreneurs. The Director of the Office of Entrepreneurial Education manages online courses, publications, and resources for entrepreneurs and small business concerns, including youth entrepreneurship programs and coordination with service providers. The Office of Entrepreneurial Education coordinates with service providers for youth entrepreneurship training, shares financial literacy materials with partners, and offers assistance to foreign visitors interested in entrepreneurship. The Office of Entrepreneurial Education offers assistance and services to individuals and foreign dignitaries interested in entrepreneurship, including small business concerns. Additionally, a National Primary and Secondary School Entrepreneurial Education Program will be established to provide grants to nonprofit organizations for entrepreneurial development. The Associate Administrator will establish a program to provide grants to nonprofit organizations for technical assistance in developing entrepreneurship curricula and mentoring programs for primary and secondary schools. Nonprofit organizations must submit an application outlining project goals and partner organizations. Nonprofit organizations seeking grants must submit an application detailing project goals, partner organizations, and any other required information. A report on individuals assisted and jobs created or saved must be submitted within one year of receiving the grant. Nonprofit organizations receiving grants must submit a report on individuals assisted, jobs created or saved, and any other required information. $3,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2013-2015. The Director of the Office of Entrepreneurial Education must submit a report on best practices within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Director of the Office of Entrepreneurial Education is required to submit a report on best practices of entrepreneurial education and training programs within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The report will describe programs throughout the United States. The report will include descriptions of exemplary entrepreneurial education programs at national, regional, state, and local levels, as well as a summary of programs by the Federal Government, state and local governments, nonprofit organizations, and private sector groups. SEC. 4. MASTER OF BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION SCHOLARSHIP PILOT PROGRAM. The Administrator may award up to 100 scholarships of $1,500 each to MBA students on a competitive basis. Recipients must provide free assistance to small businesses for 1-2 weeks. At least 50% of recipients must be students at higher education institutions. The Administrator ensures that at least 50% of MBA students receiving $1,500 scholarships provide assistance to small businesses for 1-2 weeks. Activities support various small business and entrepreneurial projects. The activities under agreements support small business concerns and entrepreneurial projects, including independent investigator-led, interdisciplinary, and multi-institutional projects. Each student receiving a scholarship must have a mentor. Data collection is required from students and small businesses receiving assistance. Under the agreement, students and small businesses must provide information on the use of assistance and employment status for 3 years after graduation. Failure to comply results in the scholarship being treated as a loan. If a student fails to comply with the agreement, their scholarship will be treated as a loan and must be repaid with interest. The Administrator is authorized $200,000 annually for this program until 2015, after which no more scholarships will be awarded. SEC. 5. REGIONAL ENTREPRENEURIAL COMPETITIONS. The Administrator will establish a program for regional competitions and a national conference to address regional challenges through entrepreneurial research and business planning. Regional offices will identify public-private issues, sponsor competitions for small businesses, inventors, and entrepreneurs, and provide outreach to universities and colleges. The program will sponsor regional competitions for small businesses, inventors, and entrepreneurs to submit research and business plans. Outreach will be provided to universities, colleges, and business communities to promote the competition. The top 3 plans addressing the identified issue will be selected in coordination with the Director of the Office of Entrepreneurship Education. A report will be submitted to the Administrator. The Administrator will organize a national conference for presenting the selected research and business plans by regional administrators. The Administrator will designate 11 employees to serve on a panel that selects the best research and business plans from each region addressing specific issues. The Administrator will award a $50,000 grant to individuals or groups with selected plans, chosen by a panel of 11 employees representing regional offices and the principal office of the Administration. The Administrator will award a $50,000 grant to individuals or groups with selected plans. Recipients must submit a report on the grant's use within a year. $750,000 is authorized for the Administrator to carry out this section. SEC. 6. STUDY ON ENTREPRENEURIAL DEFERMENT OF STUDENT LOANS. The Administrator, in consultation with the Secretary of Education, must submit a report to Congress within 180 days with recommendations for legislation forgiving student loans and deferring repayments to assist youth entrepreneurship by providing capital for business formation.
